column5: Thanks, sounds like we are in for relearning much of the lake as it will be a lot different then it has. We troll harnesses most of the time, may do the troll to find them then some jigging. As always, will be looking for wind swept areas to go shallow for them.With the lake cold and water high, any other suggestions?Thanks again. We leave tomorrow!!!!!!!:thumbsup :Just a little excited...
Gearing up for 2013 season at Gouin. Headed up July 16. Anyone out there have info on recent water level for the reservoir?
The water is very high at is maxmum.

Late spring flooding along the St Lawrence forced the hydro reservoir's in the St Lawrence watershed to hold back on water releases. Like Andre said, levels are at maximum. I was at the Gouin the 1st of June and the water levels rose all week.
In May and June we did get double the amount of rain we habitually receive. Get ready for the black flies
Thanks for info concerning water level on Gouin. Lets us be prepared for limited beaches and definite need for hip boots to do some off shore spinnerbaits for shallow pike and hiking the dog.

Heading up to Oasis do Gouin in the morning. Weather is showing very hot hope the fishing will be all right. Still will be a good relaxing week fish or no fish we will come home weighing more as we have a ton of food.Will try and post a report when we get back.
Good times and fishing eight4. A week of fishing the Gouin, fish or few fish, is just what everyone needs.

Doreover -Definitely good times, will be up there the same time you are (11th-19th). Best of luck, will report when we get back as well. Thanks for asking the question that we wanted answered as well!!!Ken
Rather than start a new topic, any reports from up there on the fishing? Leaving Friday and would appreciate any info on colors, depths, bugs???Anything would be appreciated.Thanks.Ken

The Gouin, is at its highest level in yrs, the fishing at lac hebert just turned on last week. the gouin takes a long time to warm up. moving water is always key, narrow slots, wind blown shores, humps any kind of structure. your outfitter should be able to put you on fish locations
